result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact or Sexual Intercourse w/ Person under Age of 13

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gary H Balsewicz

defendant.name: Balsewicz, Gary H
defendant.address: 3950 South Clement Avenue, St Francis, WI 53235

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Gary H Balsewicz in court.  Attorney Annette E Rauch in court for Gary H Balsewicz.  Attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for preliminary hearing. Preliminary hearing proceeded. Sworn for the State: MPD Police Officer K. Miller. State rests. Defense rests. Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defendant out on bail; defense waives bail hearing. Case is adjourned to Branch 45. Scheduling conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with BS (DOB 3/28/06); AMP (DOB 5/1/84); BLS (DOB 8/9/76).
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
Oral No Contact Order with persons under the age of 18.

DUE TO TECHNICAL ISSUES, THIS HEARING WAS HELD OFF THE RECORD. THIS IS NOT THE OFFICIAL RECORD. Defendant Gary H Balsewicz appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Annette E Rauch appeared by video for Gary H Balsewicz. Attorney Mallory R Davis appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. Commissioner advised if DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant Court orders the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4) 
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 099480,

Amount: $20.00

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
